title: Bird nest

properties.name: description
properties.value: Bird nests are items found through activities such as Woodcutting, bird house trapping, and killing the Giant mole. There are several varieties of nests, which either contain seeds, rings, or bird's eggs.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:bird's nest

Bird nests are items found through activities such as Woodcutting, bird house trapping, and killing the Giant mole. There are several varieties of nests, which either contain seeds, rings, or bird's eggs.

Most activities reward a random selection of seed, ring, and egg nests. Additionally, some activities reward clue nests, which contain a clue scroll. Opening all types of clue nests except beginner will provide an empty nest.

Contents

  • 1 Obtaining
  • 2 Types of nests
    • 2.1 Seed nest
    • 2.2 Ring nest
    • 2.3 Egg nest
    • 2.4 Wyson nest
    • 2.5 Clue nest
    • 2.6 Empty nest
  • 3 Discontinued nests
    • 3.1 Wyson nests (2006-2016)
    • 3.2 Pre-Farming Guild
  • 4 Changes

Obtaining[edit | edit source]

  • Randomly dropped while Woodcutting.
    • The chance of getting a bird nest from a tree is 1/256 each time you would normally get a log, regardless of the type of tree.
    • Players who equip a Woodcutting cape will have an additional 10% chance of receiving bird nests from chopping trees.
  • Reward from Managing Miscellania when subjects are tasked with collecting maple, teak or mahogany logs.
  • Reward from offering bird's eggs to the shrine in the Woodcutting Guild.
  • Received from Wyson the gardener in Falador Park in exchange for mole claw and mole skin.
  • Received when emptying bird house traps on Fossil Island.
  • Received when chopping ent trunks.
  • Received as a possible tip during Gnome Restaurant minigame.

Types of nests[edit | edit source]

Seed nest[edit | edit source]

Main article: Bird nest (seeds)

Seed nests contain a random tree or fruit tree seed. These nests can be obtained through Woodcutting, bird house trapping, chopping ent trunks, Managing Miscellania, or during Gnome Restaurant. They can also be obtained by using a bird's egg on the shrine in the Woodcutting Guild.

Wearing a strung rabbit foot decreases the chance of seed nests while woodcutting, by replacing some seed nests drops with ring and egg nests. However, wearing a strung rabbit foot while bird house trapping does not affect the chance of getting seed nests.

Ring nest[edit | edit source]

Main article: Bird nest (ring)

Ring nests contain a random type of either gold, sapphire, emerald, ruby, or diamond ring.

Ring nests are found from woodcutting, Managing Miscellania, bird house trapping, chopping ent trunks, and trading mole parts with Wyson.

Wearing a strung rabbit foot while woodcutting or bird house trapping makes ring nests slightly more likely by replacing some drops of seed or empty nests.

Egg nest[edit | edit source]

Main article: Bird nest (egg)

Egg nests contain one of the three types of bird's eggs. The colour of the egg is visible in the nest, so it is possible to tell which egg will be received before searching the nest. The eggs can be offered to the shrine in the Woodcutting Guild to receive 100 Prayer experience as well as a seed nest or piece of the evil chicken outfit.

Egg nests are received from woodcutting, bird house trapping, chopping ent trunks, and Managing Miscellania.

Wearing a strung rabbit foot increases the chance of getting egg nests while woodcutting or bird house trapping, by replacing some drops of seed or empty nests.

Wyson nest[edit | edit source]

Main article: Bird nest (Wyson)

A variant type of seed nest is received from Wyson the gardener in Falador Park. These nests commonly contain low level allotment seeds, but can also reward high level herb, tree, and fruit tree seeds. Wyson provides 1 nest in exchange for each mole claw and mole skin given to him. The mole parts can be noted, and will be exchanged for nest boxes if there is not enough room in the inventory. These boxes can be extracted at a bank to obtain the nests.

Clue nest[edit | edit source]

Main article: Clue nest

Clue nests are nests that can be found while training Woodcutting or emptying bird houses on Fossil Island. Searching them will give players a clue scroll of the indicated difficulty, leaving an empty bird nest (excluding beginner clue nests). Like clue scrolls, players can only have one of each type of clue nest in their possession.

Empty nest[edit | edit source]

Main article: Bird nest (empty)

Most nests produce an empty nest after searching their contents. Empty nests can be crushed with a pestle and mortar to get a crushed nest, which is used in Herblore to create Saradomin brews. Bird nests are only tradeable when empty or crushed.

Some activities can also provide empty nests, such as bird house trapping and trading mole parts with Wyson.

Discontinued nests[edit | edit source]

Wyson nests (2006-2016)[edit | edit source]

Main article: Bird nest (Wyson, 2006-2016)

Seed nests from Wyson originally rewarded relatively low level seeds, and were considered to not be valuable enough compared to the difficulty of the content. To improve the nests, Wyson nests were updated on 18 February 2016 to reward more valuable seeds. Wyson nests obtained prior to this update could still exist in player banks and inventories and can be searched to provide seeds from the original reward table.

Pre-Farming Guild[edit | edit source]

Main article: Bird nest (seeds, 2005-2019)
Main article: Bird nest (Wyson, 2016-2019)

Seed nests and Wyson nests were updated on 10 January 2019 with the release of the Farming Guild. All nests previously obtained would remain in banks and inventories, and new nests would be added that contained dragonfruit, celastrus, and redwood tree seeds. Snape grass seeds were also added to Wyson nests. This change was made to prevent players from obtaining large quantities of the new seeds immediately upon release of the content.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
10 January 2019
(update)

Seed nests and Wyson nests are discontinued, and new nests become available that can reward dragonfruit, celastrus, and redwood tree seeds. Wyson nests can also provide snape grass seeds.

20 September 2018
(update)

The item's value was increased from 20 to 453 so that it would appear above logs when on the ground, with the exception of Wyson's original nests which had the x-rotation value of their inventory icon increased to 453 instead.

22 March 2018
(update)

The item's value was increased from 1 to 20.

27 October 2016
(update)
  • Empty nests were made tradeable.
  • Empty nests could now be made into banknotes.
14 April 2016
(update)

The message received when causing a bird's nest to fall whilst woodcutting is now displayed in red.

18 February 2016
(update)

The original Wyson seed nests are discontinued and new Wyson nests are introduced with more valuable seed drops.

27 March 2014
(update | poll)

Can now be received as a drop when chopping the log left by a slain Ent.
